content: Tiruchi district occupied top slot by attracting 23.09 lakh tourists in August while Madurai, which drew 21.65 tourists, remains a top draw with foreign travellers

content: CM says Kerala is now fully connected through optical fibre and provides high quality talent, and which together provides the most ideal destination for investment and innovation

content: The Mridangam maestro is privileged to celebrate both 80 years of his illustrious musical career and his 90th birthday at the very same venue ‚Äî the Kalahastheeswarar Temple on Madathu Theru in Kumbakonam.

title: ISRO lines up 7 launches, including uncrewed Gaganyaan mission by March 2026

content: Minister for Public Works Satish Jarkiholi has said that it was natural for the Congress leaders to meet the High Command when in Delhi but he had no information on possibility of chief minister and deputy chief minister meeting those in the party high command.

title: Manipur BJP MLAs Meet In Delhi To Discuss Peace, Progress
content: The BJP Manipur Legislature Party meeting in Delhi on Sunday discussed peace and progress in the state. The meeting was attended by more than 30 MLAs, including two from the Kuki community.

title: "Will Win Even In Bengal": BJP's New Working President To NDTV
content: Bihar minister Nitin Nabin, who was elevated to the position of the BJP's Working President, told NDTV today that his priority would be to strengthen the party organisation.

title: Who Is Ahmed Al Ahmed, The Heroic Bystander Who Disarmed Sydney Shooter
content: Australians on Sunday praised a man described as a "hero" after his quick thinking during a mass shooting at Sydney's Bondi Beach, the deadliest attack in the country in years.

title: Hardworking, Trusted, Future-Ready: Who Is BJP Working President Nitin Nabin
content: Nitin Nabin's appointment as the Bharatiya Janata Party's national working president signals the party's renewed emphasis on organisational strength and generational transition ahead of key electoral battles.

title: Vandalism To Arson: Antisemitic Attacks In Australia Since October 7 Attacks
content: Australia has experienced a string of antisemitic attacks on synagogues, buildings and cars since the beginning of Israel's war in Gaza in October 2023.

title: Man Who Killed US Soldiers Was Part Of Syria's Security Forces
content: Syria's interior ministry said Sunday that the gunman who killed three Americans in the central Palmyra region the previous day was a member of the security forces who was set to be fired for extremism.

title: Only 48% Turnout In Punjab's Rural Body Polls, Opposition Alleges Violence
content: Polling for Punjab's zila parishad and block samiti elections ended amid allegations of violence and a subdued voter response, with only 48 per cent turnout recorded across the state.

title: Israel's Antisemitism Charge Against Australia Government After Beach Attack
content: Israeli leaders condemned a shooting in Sydney targeting a Hanukkah celebration that killed 11 people on Sunday, with various government officials suggesting Australia had failed to combat hatred of Jews.

title: Woman, 48, Stabbed To Death Inside Temple In Delhi, 1 Arrested: Cops
content: The national capital recorded the highest AQI of the season on Sunday -- up to 461 from 432 a day earlier -- as the air quality remained in the "severe" category, according to the Central Pollution Control Board.

title: 5 Men Suspected Of Planning Christmas Market Attack Arrested In Germany
content: German authorities have arrested five men suspected of being Islamist terrorists planning an attack on a Christmas market in southern Bavaria, police and prosecutors said in a joint statement.

title: Person Of Interest In US University Shooting That Killed 2 Taken Into Custody
content: Police in Rhode Island said early Sunday that they had a person of interest in custody after a shooting that rocked the Brown University campus during final exams, leaving two people dead and nine others wounded.

title: Delhi Records Highest AQI Of Season At 461, Air Quality Remains 'Severe'
content: The national capital recorded the highest AQI of the season on Sunday -- up to 461 from 432 a day earlier -- as the air quality remained in the "severe" category, according to the Central Pollution Control Board.

title: A Democrat Trying To Make A Blue Wave Happen & The Republican Trying To Stop It
content: Both lawmakers were forged by the lessons of 2018, when Democrats flipped dozens of Republican-held seats to turn the rest of Trump's first term into a political crucible.

content: BJP appointed senior Bihar leaderNitinNabinas itsNationalExecutivePresident, following his widely-acknowledged role in dismantling the Congress stronghold inChhattisgarhand steering theBJPtoa decisive returnto

title: 13 Phones, Ganja Packets Seized Amid New Karnataka Prisons Chief's Crackdown
content: Karnataka's newly appointed Director General of Police for Prisons and Correctional Services, Alok Kumar, launched a statewide crackdown within just 72 hours of assuming charge on Thursday.

title: Bihar Minister Nitin Nabin Appointed BJP's National Working President
content: Bihar Minister Nitin Nabin was on Sunday appointed as the BJP national working president and is likely to eventually succeed JP Nadda as its national president, signalling a generational shift in the ruling party.

title: 28 Students Injured After School Bus Plunges From Bridge In Madhya Pradesh
content: A school picnic turned into a terrifying ordeal on Sunday morning when a bus carrying students and staff from Higher Secondary School, Bahadurpur, fell from a 12-foot-high bridge over the Sagad River in Madhya Pradesh's Vidisha district.

title: Student Dies, 31 Injured As School Bus Collides With Vehicle In Haryana: Cops
content: A student died while 31 others were injured after a school bus collided with a Haryana Roadways bus amid low visibility due to foggy weather conditions in Jhajjar on Sunday, officials said.

title: Local Jewish Rabbi: First Victim Of Deadly Australia Beach Attack Identified
content: The first victim from the shooting in Sydney's Bondi Beach today has been identified as Rabbi Eli Schlanger.

title: 'Bang bang bang': Eyewitnesses recount panic during Bondi Beach shooting in Sydney
content: Tragedy struck Bondi Beach as a violent shooting left eleven dead and several injured. Eyewitnesses described a terrifying scene of continuous gunfire, with reports of two gunmen. Panic ensued as people fled the popular tourist spot, with victims seen on the ground. Authorities confirmed one shooter was killed and another critically wounded.

title: 3rd T20I: Seamers wreak havoc; India thrash SA by 7 wickets to go 2-1 up
content: India secured a commanding 2-1 series lead against South Africa, thanks to exceptional swing bowling from Arshdeep Singh and Harshit Rana.  The duo dismantled the Proteas' top order, restricting them to a mere 117.  Aiden Markram's valiant 61 was the lone highlight for the visitors. India's chase was then comfortably navigated, ensuring a seven-wicket victory.

title: Privacy settings to 'public': Trump tightens H-1B screening; social media checks from December 15
content: US visa applicants, including H-1B workers and their families, must now make social media profiles public for enhanced screening. This directive, effective December 15, extends existing measures for students and exchange visitors. The State Department views visa decisions as national security matters, utilizing all available information to vet applicants for potential risks.

title: Bondi Beach shooting: Agencies identify one gunman - what we know so far
content: Australian authorities have identified Naveed Akram as one of the alleged gunmen in the deadly Bondi Beach shooting that killed at least 12 people. Investigations are ongoing, with police raiding Akram's residence. The incident, which occurred during a Hanukkah event, has been designated a terrorist attack, and an improvised explosive device was found linked to one of the deceased attackers.

title: AI models: Oracle founder lists 2 types, says Musk‚Äôs Tesla uses ‚Äòlow-latency‚Äô
content: Oracle founder Larry Ellison distinguished between two AI model types: those requiring real-time, low-latency decisions for applications like self-driving cars and robotics, and those where delays are acceptable, such as chatbots. He highlighted Tesla's use of local compute for immediate responses, emphasizing that both categories are crucial for AI's future.

title: Pink tax, safety tax, health tax & more: The 'hidden cost' of being a woman no one counts
content: Do women end up paying hidden taxes just to survive? From the 'pink tax' to 'safety tax' and more, where women pay more for gendered products and essential safety measures. Does simply existing as a woman become financially and emotionally more expensive, a burden society continues to overlook but hard to escape.

title: Bondi beach mass shooting: Video captures people fleeing to nearby cafe for cover - watch
content: Tragedy struck Sydney's Bondi Beach as two suspected shooters opened fire, claiming nine lives and injuring eleven. Panic erupted as beachgoers fled the popular tourist spot. One assailant was killed, the other critically wounded. The attack occurred near a Hanukkah celebration, prompting condemnation from Israeli President Isaac Herzog as a "cruel attack on Jews."

title: AI comeback question: Did Sergey Brin help save Google? Sundar Pichai breaks it down
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin's return to hands-on AI development, coding and analyzing training loss curves, has coincided with the company's recent AI surge. While not a formal executive, his technical insight and urgency reinforced Google's accelerated execution, particularly with the Gemini models. This renewed focus has repositioned Google as a top-tier AI competitor.

title: Neurosurgeon explains why Japanese people live longer and healthier lives
content: A neurosurgeon reveals Japan's exceptional longevity stems not just from diet, but from daily habits. Consistent routines, mindful eating with smaller portions, integrated physical activity, and strong social connections significantly reduce strain on the nervous system and metabolism. This approach fosters healthier aging, emphasizing preventive care and a balanced lifestyle over quick fixes.

title: Congress leader Shamanuru Shivashankarappa passes away at 95; tributes pour in
content: Shamanuru Shivashankarappa, a seasoned politician and revered six-time MLA, has sadly passed away at the age of 95 after battling age-related ailments. His commitment to the upliftment of education and community service marked his illustrious career. His departure is a significant loss for Karnataka's political landscape and the Veerashaiva-Lingayat community, prompting leaders from all sides to express their condolences.

title: BJP gets new chief: Bihar minister Nitin Nabin appointed working president
content: Nitin Nabin has been appointed as the new national working president of the Bharatiya Janata Party, succeeding JP Nadda. A PWD minister in Bihar and MLA from Patna's Bankipur constituency, Nabin's political journey began in student politics with the ABVP. He has established himself as a key urban and infrastructure leader since entering electoral politics in the late 2000s.

title: Climate migration begins: Tuvaluans relocate to Australia; special visas take effect
content: Australia has welcomed the first climate migrants from Tuvalu, a Pacific nation facing inundation due to rising sea levels. A groundbreaking bilateral treaty allows Tuvaluans to live, study, and work in Australia, receiving immediate access to essential services. This initiative offers a dignified pathway as the island nation grapples with existential threats from climate change.

title: IPL Auction: Ahead of the curve ‚Äî Pandya's MI enter with little to worry
content: Mumbai Indians, a formidable IPL side, enter the 2026 auction with a strong squad after a successful 2025 season. Despite a few areas for refinement, their existing talent pool, including stars like Bumrah and Suryakumar Yadav, positions them as strong contenders to end their title drought. Hardik Pandya's side looks formidable enough to take on any team.

title: South's 'Ayodhya' moment? Why Karthigai deepam row matters beyond Tamil Nadu
content: Thiruparankundram, a hill in Tamil Nadu with a history of religious coexistence, is now a flashpoint for political and legal battles. A dispute over lighting a sacred lamp during the Karthigai deepam festival has escalated, pitting the DMK against the BJP and raising questions about judicial authority and communal harmony.

title: Suns vs Lakers (Dec 14): Preview, injury report, lineups and how to watch
content: The Lakers, 17-7, face the surprising 14-11 Phoenix Suns on the road after an NBA Cup elimination. Despite injuries, the Suns, led by Dillon Brooks and coaching, have been competitive. The Lakers, coming off a defensive lapse, will rely on Luka Doncic and LeBron James against a tenacious Phoenix squad.

title: Connor McDavid‚Äôs wife, Lauren Kyle launches Sports Club Atelier collection
content: Lauren Kyle, wife of NHL star Connor McDavid, is launching a Canada-inspired collection for her brand, Sports Club Atelier, in January. Drawing inspiration from vintage winter advertising and alpine campaigns, the line features red-and-white pieces designed for fans to express patriotic pride fashionably at sporting events and in everyday life.

title: Triple H & Stephanie McMahon net worth 2025: WWE careers & ventures
content: Triple H and Stephanie McMahon's combined net worth is estimated at $500 million in 2025, reflecting their significant contributions to WWE's corporate and creative success. Their leadership in talent development, branding, and strategic expansion has built a strong financial foundation and continues to shape WWE's future identity and growth under TKO.

title: Blake Lively calls Taylor Swift ‚Äòthe dreamiest friend‚Äô amid Eras Tour buzz
content: Blake Lively celebrated a business venture amid reports of a strained friendship with Taylor Swift. Swift is reportedly "hurt" and feels used due to Lively's legal issues involving her "It Ends with Us" co-star. Lively's social media post focused on her haircare brand collaboration, pointedly avoiding any mention of Swift, highlighting a careful navigation of public perception and personal relationships.

title: Sydney: Bondi Beach shooting toll rises to 12; one gunman killed, other critical
content: A horrific shooting at Sydney's Bondi Beach has claimed at least 12 lives, with authorities labeling it a terrorist incident. Police responded to the developing situation, urging the public to avoid the area. The attack occurred during a Hanukkah celebration, prompting condemnation and calls to combat antisemitism.

title: Debt, reclusion, deaths: Inside Kalkaji triple tragedy that shocked Delhi
content: A 52-year-old woman and her two adult sons were found dead in their Delhi flat, a tragedy marked by deep isolation and financial distress. Neighbours reported months of withdrawal and an earlier suicide attempt by the brothers, who were unemployed and in debt. The family had also not paid rent for two years, leading to an eviction order.

title: Best late night snack for people with high blood pressure
content: Ever lie awake hungry at night and worry about how a snack might affect your blood sugar? Late-night eating isn‚Äôt off-limits for people with diabetes‚Äîbut it demands smarter choices. This piece breaks down what dietitians look for in a bedtime option, how gut health and minerals come into play, and why this one snack checks above boxes.

title: BJP's surprise pick for president: Why Nitin Nabin matters
content: The BJP has appointed Bihar minister Nitin Nabin as its youngest Working National President, highlighting a strategic shift towards experienced, quiet strategists. Nabin's appointment underscores the party's focus on organizational strength and cadre management, particularly with a renewed emphasis on eastern India. This move signals a commitment to loyalty and effective execution in national politics.

title: Vanessa Bryant gets emotional as UConn, USC honor Kobe and Gigi with tribute
content: The UConn Huskies beat the USC Trojans by 28 points. The game became emotional as players honored Kobe and Gigi Bryant. Both teams wore different Kobe sneakers. Vanessa Bryant shared pictures of the athletes on her Instagram. This tribute highlighted the lasting impact of Kobe and Gigi on basketball. Gigi had wished to play for UConn.

title: 3rd T20I: Record! Pandya becomes first Indian to achieve this feat
content: Hardik Pandya achieved a remarkable T20I milestone, becoming the first Indian to claim 100 wickets and score over 1,000 runs in the format. This historic feat was accomplished during the recent India vs. South Africa match. Pandya's all-round prowess continues to shine, adding his name to an elite global list of cricketers.

title: Sydney terror attack: IED found in car linked to Bondi Beach shooting; probe widens
content: Sydney's Bondi Beach was rocked by a terrorist attack during Hanukkah festivities, with two gunmen killing 11 and injuring several. Authorities discovered an improvised explosive device in a vehicle linked to one of the deceased attackers. Prime Minister Albanese condemned the targeted act of hate, emphasizing it was an attack on all Australians.

title: Lionel Messi, Sachin share No. 10 moment; Chhetri leads football fiesta
content: Lionel Messi's hour-long visit to Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium during his GOAT India Tour 2025 was a resounding success, delighting fans and dignitaries alike. He shared a memorable moment with cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar, presented with a signed jersey. The event also saw the launch of Project Maha-deva to support young footballers.

title: Rohtak bodybuilder murder: 3 accused, including two brothers, arrested in Bengaluru
content: Haryana Police have apprehended three individuals from Bengaluru in connection with the murder of bodybuilder Rohit Dhankhar in Bhiwani. The arrests follow an alleged reprisal attack after Dhankhar objected to lewd comments made at a wedding. The state's Sarv Khap has issued an ultimatum to the government for action and compensation.

title: ‚ÄòBrought untold shame‚Äô: Bengal gov fumes over Messi event chaos; urges for strict action
content: West Bengal governor CV Ananda Bose has called the chaos at Lionel Messi's event a "shame" for Kolkata and football lovers. He demanded strict accountability, including a judicial inquiry and arrests of organizers, emphasizing the need for a standard operating procedure for managing large congregations to prevent public suffering during commercialized events.

title: Sydney shooting: Bystander tackles gunman at Bondi Beach; heroic act caught on camera
content: Chaos erupted at Sydney's Bondi Beach as a gunman opened fire, killing at least 11 people. A dramatic video shows a brave bystander tackling the shooter and disarming him amidst the panic. Police have apprehended two individuals following the terrifying incident near a Hanukkah event.  The scene was one of widespread fear and immediate medical response.

title: 'Consistently reiterated position': India rebuts Dhaka's charges; denies hostile acts
content: India has firmly rejected Bangladesh's interim government's assertions, stating New Delhi consistently supports free, fair, and inclusive elections in the neighboring country. India denied allowing its territory to be used for activities hostile to Bangladesh's interests and called on Dhaka to ensure internal law and order for peaceful elections.

title: 'Yeh constable ka ghar hai?: Dismissed UP cop‚Äôs house in posh Lucknow locality sparks outrage
content: A viral video of a dismissed Uttar Pradesh constable's opulent Lucknow residence has stunned social media users. Alok Pratap Singh, arrested for his alleged role in a codeine-based cough syrup smuggling network, reportedly invested in the illicit trade, earning substantial profits far exceeding his official salary. The lavish home has ignited debate on corruption within law enforcement.

title: 'I arrived late because of my visa': Indian student on challenges of studying in Aus
content: Anvitha Reddy's journey to Monash University in Australia involved extensive applications and a challenging start due to a visa delay. She adapted to a flexible academic system, balancing studies with a part-time digital marketing role and managing living costs through student accommodation. Building a social circle took time, but she found connections through her accommodation and university activities.

title: 'There‚Äôs no need for‚Ä¶': Former India coach sends clear message to Shubman Gill
content: Former India batter Sanjay Bangar urged Shubman Gill to focus on stability and proper cricketing shots at the top of the order, rather than big hits. Bangar believes Gill's role is to see off the new ball and absorb pressure, laying the platform for explosive hitters. This advice follows Gill's recent struggles in the T20I series against South Africa.

title: BJP gets new national prez: Who is Nitin Nabin, the Bihar minister who replaced Nadda
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party has appointed Bihar minister Nitin Nabin as its national working president, a significant organizational shift. Nabin, a four-time MLA from Patna's Bankipur constituency, brings extensive grassroots experience and a strong organizational background to the party's national leadership.

title: Brown University shooting: Person of interest in custody; manhunt ends
content: A person of interest is in custody following a deadly shooting at Brown University that claimed two lives and injured nine. The incident, which occurred during a final exam review, triggered a massive manhunt and widespread panic across Providence. Authorities are investigating the motive behind the attack, one of the deadliest on a US campus recently.

title: 'Zero tolerance towards terrorism': PM Modi condemns 'ghastly' attack in Sydney
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar have strongly condemned the terrorist attack at Sydney's Bondi Beach, which claimed 11 lives and injured 16 others. The attack occurred during a Hanukkah celebration, and India has expressed solidarity with Australia, reiterating its zero-tolerance policy towards terrorism.

title: 'Our fight is against RSS, BJP; against gaddars indulging in vote chori': Kharge at Congress rally
content: The Congress intensified its campaign against alleged vote manipulation and electoral roll revisions with a massive rally in Delhi. Leaders like Mallikarjun Kharge and Rahul Gandhi addressed the gathering, accusing the government of stealing mandates and questioning the Election Commission's impartiality. The party claims to have collected over five crore signatures nationwide to highlight these concerns.

title: Sydney: Bondi Beach mass shooting declared 'terror incident' - top developments
content: A violent mass shooting by two gunmen at Sydney's famous Bondi Beach during a Chanukah celebration left nine people dead and several injured. One attacker was killed by police, while another was tackled by a bystander before being arrested. The attack has drawn widespread condemnation from national and international leaders.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office day 10: Ranveer, Akshaye Khanna, R Madhavan starrer crosses Rs 300 cr
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' has shattered expectations, crossing the ‚Çπ300 crore mark in its second week. The film, directed by Aditya Dhar, opened strong and maintained impressive momentum, especially with a remarkable ‚Çπ53 crore collection on its second Saturday.  This massive success has left audiences and industry watchers astounded.

title: Joey Porter Sr. admits Dolphins years hurt his family and passion for football
content: Joey Porter Sr. revealed the profound impact of his time with the struggling Miami Dolphins, which contrasted sharply with his winning culture in Pittsburgh.  The constant losses deeply affected his family, turning game days into dreaded events and forcing him to re-evaluate his role as both a player and father.

title: AQI ‚Äòsevere plus‚Äô in Delhi: CAQM suspends all outdoor sports; warns of serious health risks to kids
content: Delhi-NCR's air quality has plunged to 'severe plus', prompting the Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) to halt all outdoor sports activities. This directive, aimed at protecting children's health, comes as the strictest Stage IV of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) is enforced. Construction bans and truck entry restrictions are also in effect, with schools adopting hybrid learning.

title: ‚Äò140+ all day‚Äô: Faster and fitter Shivam Mavi ready for IPL return | Exclusive
content: After three injury-hit years away from the IPL, Shivam Mavi feels reborn. Having fixed action-related side-flexion issues, the 27-year-old has played consistently for Uttar Pradesh across formats, clocking 140+ consistently.

title: Mass shooting at Bondi Beach: Australian PM Albanese calls situation ‚Äòdistressing‚Äô
content: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese expressed shock following a mass shooting at Sydney's Bondi Beach, where multiple fatalities were reported. Emergency services are on the scene, with eight individuals transported to hospitals. The Prime Minister is coordinating with state officials and urging those nearby to follow police instructions.

title: ‚ÄòDifficult times‚Äô: Hamas confirms top commander Raed Saad killed in Israeli strike
content: Hamas confirmed the killing of senior leader Raed Saad and aides by Israeli forces, a day after Israel announced the operation. Saad, described as an architect of the October 7 attack and second-in-command of Hamas's armed wing, was reportedly killed in Gaza's tunnel network. This development risks further destabilizing the fragile truce.

title: Uttar Pradesh: BJP unanimously elects Pankaj Chaudhary state president; who is he?
content: Pankaj Chaudhary, Union Minister of State for Finance, has been unanimously elected as the Uttar Pradesh BJP president. A seven-time MP from Maharajganj, Chaudhary began his political career at the grassroots level. His appointment ahead of key political challenges is seen as a thoughtful decision by the party high command.

title: Sources: Tigers sign Jansen to bolster bullpen
